Kenshiro can go intangible, that means nothing can touch him. Nothing.
He even can "teleport" to other points.
One single punch of Kenshrio, and you are dead. It cannot be a punch, he could you just one finger and turn you into a bloody mess.
How you will stop someone that you can't touch and can kill you with a single finger?
[/bq]
Can he remain intangible while he's frozen in time?[/bq]
He can be intangible any time he wamts

topics.body:
"@Shadow the Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559b55836368721b26003128#post_559b55836368721b26003128

"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559b55b963687225d900052b#post_559b55b963687225d900052b


Intangible means his body has no physical mass but still exists within the frame that is "When" so he is still affected by the passage of time even if he can't be touched physically.

In other words, Kenshiro would be paralyzed in Dio's Stand but he would be impervious to direct physical attacks.

topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559b570f6368721b2600333e#post_559b570f6368721b2600333e

"@Shadow the Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559b57006368721b26003321#post_559b57006368721b26003321

That depends. When Dio uses his Stand he just makes time to stop, doesn't make it go fowards or backwards it just5 stands still and he's capable of moving between that moment. When Dio punches someone he does it by coming in directing contact with the skin of the target, ergo, he doesn't use magic or the like to touch someone and the injuries they suffer appear once the effect is over as if they had been inflicted instantaneously.

Kenshiro's ability to remain intangible means no physical harm can get to him by direct means, aka punching him. So while he can be stopped in place, unless Dio goes the extra mile, he still won't be able to harm Kenshiro if he can't bypass the lack of physical mass.
